definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
to eat and drink/food and drink
drinking water/to obtain water (for daily needs)/to absorb water/draft (of ship)

sentences.english: I ate a few minutes ago.
sentences.chinese: 吃了，我幾分鐘前吃了飯。

sentences.english: Elisa started at the sound of her husband's voice.
sentences.chinese: 聽到丈夫的聲音，伊利莎吃了一驚。

sentences.english: He ate a bar of candy and then asked for another.
sentences.chinese: 他吃了一塊糖，然後又要了一塊。

sentences.english: Buzzing insects will infest all your trees and the crops of your soil.
sentences.chinese: 害蟲要吃盡你所有的樹木和土地的出產。

sentences.english: I just had a super-duper meal in the restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我剛剛在餐廳吃了一頓超級大餐。

sentences.english: She was surprised by a wanton thought that rushed into her mind.
sentences.chinese: 一個放肆的念頭在她心裏閃過，叫她吃了一驚。

sentences.english: I would rather have noodles than rice.
sentences.chinese: 我寧願吃麪條也不喫米飯。

sentences.english: At supper she had two huge plates full of lasagna.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯時她吃了兩大碗滿滿當當的肉醬寬麪條。

sentences.english: After the waitress arrived with our food, we ate in silence for a time.
sentences.chinese: 女招待端來了我們的晚餐，我們默默地吃了一會兒。

sentences.english: Then we had lunch in a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 然後，我們在一家餐館吃了午飯。

sentences.english: 50But here is the bread that comes down from heaven, which a man may eat and not die.
sentences.chinese: 這是從天上降下來的糧，叫人吃了就不死。

sentences.english: On the half way to the mountain, the tourists had a rest and snacked on some bread.
sentences.chinese: 在登山的途中，遊客們休息了會兒，吃了點兒麪包。
一條澳洲野狗吃了我的孩子。

sentences.english: Do you think we can sponge a meal from your parents?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲我們能從你父母那兒不混頓飯吃了嗎？

sentences.english: After eating the fine snack, Empress Dowager Cixi was fairly satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧太后吃了這精美的點心之後，很滿意。

sentences.english: He took some anodyne to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 他吃了些止痛藥來緩解疼痛。

definition: to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
way of eating/how something is eaten/how a dish is prepared/the way a dish is to be cooked
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
